body_html:
@jart
Thanks for replying :)
The "problem" at #923 isn't the same as this described bug. My code behaves differently when running the summary operation as opposed to when not running the summary operation.

The main difference is that there are 10 images in my dataset and when not running the summary op, I can read all images this way.
However, if I run the summary operation I can only read one image before getting these warnings saying that the queue is closed.

@jart Did you run the script I sent and didn't observe this different behavior? Is this the reason why you closed the issue?
Does the summary operation read internally more images? Because I can't explain why this different behavior occurs to me... That's also why I opened this issue, instead of going to stackoverflow to post an implementation question :)

body:
@jart
Thanks for replying :)
The "problem" at #923 isn't the same as this described bug. My code behaves differently when running the summary operation as opposed to when not running the summary operation.

The main difference is that there are 10 images in my dataset and when not running the summary op, I can read all images this way. 
However, if I run the summary operation I can only read one image before getting these warnings saying that the queue is closed. 

@jart Did you run the script I sent and didn't observe this different behavior? Is this the reason why you closed the issue?
Does the summary operation read internally more images? Because I can't explain why this different behavior occurs to me... That's also why I opened this issue, instead of going to stackoverflow to post an implementation question :)
